definition: thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with
insipid/diluted/weak/mild/light in color/tasteless/indifferent/(variant of 氮[dan4]) nitrogen

sentences.english: Dilute the orange juice with water before you drink it.
It ignores one’s audience and waters down your message.
sentences.chinese: 它忽视了听众，也把要传达的信息大大冲淡。

sentences.english: Drink hot soup or a large number of drinking water, with dilutes alcohol concentration.
sentences.chinese: 多喝热汤或大量饮用开水，用以冲淡酒精的浓度。

sentences.english: Lobby groups could water down plans that will cost industry money.
sentences.chinese: 游说团体可以冲淡这个耗费企业资金的计划。

sentences.english: Don't stress minor issues at the expense of the central task.
sentences.chinese: 不要因次要问题而冲淡了中心任务。

sentences.english: She diluted the milk with water.
This will dilute everything in your stomach and make it much easier.
sentences.chinese: 这会冲淡你胃里的一切东西，使呕吐变得容易许多。

sentences.english: The little light fades the immense and diaphanous shadows.
sentences.chinese: 微微曙光把庞大透明的阴影冲淡了。

sentences.english: Her coffee was too strong, so Hellen diluted it with milk.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡太浓，艾伦用牛奶将其冲淡。
时候可以冲淡最强烈的哀痛。

sentences.english: Dilute the juice (with water) before you drink it.
sentences.chinese: 喝果汁之前，用水把它冲淡。

sentences.english: Because hall is located in moon face, reason uses shallow and shining Bo to change a brick to come diluent.
sentences.chinese: 由于厅位于阴面，故采用浅而光亮的玻化砖来冲淡。

sentences.english: Previous attempts at bold reform have often been watered down.
sentences.chinese: 先前大胆的改革努力通常都被冲淡了。

sentences.english: He has tempered the strong drink with water.
sentences.chinese: 他已经用水将烈酒冲淡。

sentences.english: Her hospitality diluted my homesickness during my stay in the country.
sentences.chinese: 在我呆在这个国家的期间，她的热情冲淡了我的乡思。

sentences.english: You add twice the amount of water recommended when making orange juice from concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 你总用两倍于建议的水量冲淡浓缩橙汁。

definition: to be forgotten/to fade from memory
to vanish like smoke in thin air/to disappear
(literary) to eliminate/to put an end to
to wear down/to sap/to whittle away/to while away/to idle away
to submerge/to drown/to flood/to drown out (also fig.)
to bury/to submerge/to pass into oblivion/to obliterate/to annihilate (physics)
